concept.title: Java Heap Size Configuration
concept.shortdesc: You can define the Java heap size used by the . By default, the Java heap size is 1024 MB.

conbody.p: The Java heap size determines the heap size allocated to the and affects the amount of memory the can use when it runs a pipeline. Running a pipeline can use up to 65% of the allocated heap size.

Define the heap size as part of the SDC_JAVA_OPTS property in the environment configuration file. Increase or decrease the heap size as necessary, based on the resources available on the host machine.

Use the following Java options to define the Java heap size:
xmx - Defines the maximum heap size
xms - Defines the minimum heap size

p.note: To avoid constant recalculation of the allocated heap size, set the both properties to the same vaue. Use m for MB and g for GB.

conbody.p: For example, to double the heap size, you might change the following default SDC_JAVA_OPTS property:SDC_JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx1024m -Xms1024m -server ${SDC_JAVA_OPTS}"
With a heap size of 2048MB, you can configure a pipeline to use up to 1331MB of memory.
